title: Attributes Configuration
description: Configuration for core character attributes, archetype-recommended builds for Simple mode allocation, and point-buy cost structure for Advanced mode. Defines the five fundamental attributes (Might, Finesse, Wits, Will, Sturdiness) with display properties, relationship mappings to derived stats and skills, pre-configured attribute allocations for each archetype, and the tiered cost table for point-buy allocation.

$schema.description: JSON schema reference for editor support

attributes.description: Array of core attribute definitions. Must contain exactly 5 attributes, one for each CoreAttribute enum value.

recommendedBuilds.description: Archetype-recommended attribute builds for Simple mode. Each entry defines a pre-configured allocation that totals to the archetype's point budget (15 for most, 14 for Adept).

attributeDefinition.description: Definition of a single core attribute with display properties and relationship mappings.

attribute.description: The CoreAttribute enum value name. Must match the C# enum exactly.

displayName.description: Uppercase display name for UI presentation (e.g., 'MIGHT', 'FINESSE').

shortDescription.description: One-line summary for tooltips and compact displays.

detailedDescription.description: Full explanation for help screens and detailed views.

affectedStats.description: Derived stats influenced by this attribute (e.g., 'Melee Damage', 'Max HP').

affectedSkills.description: Skills that use this attribute for checks (e.g., 'Combat', 'Lore').

recommendedBuild.description: A pre-configured attribute allocation for a specific archetype, used in Simple mode during character creation.

archetypeId.description: Lowercase archetype identifier matching the archetype system (e.g., 'warrior', 'mystic').

totalPoints.description: Total point cost of this build. Typically 15 for most archetypes, 14 for Adept.

pointBuyConfiguration.description: Configuration for the point-buy attribute allocation system used in Advanced mode during character creation. Defines starting point pools, attribute value constraints, and the tiered cost table.

startingPoints.description: Standard starting point pool for most archetypes (Warrior, Skirmisher, Mystic).

adeptStartingPoints.description: Reduced starting point pool for the Adept archetype, balancing broader utility access.

minAttributeValue.description: Minimum value for any attribute. All attributes start at this value in Advanced mode.

maxAttributeValue.description: Maximum value any attribute can reach through point-buy allocation.

costTable.description: Ordered cost entries for each target value above the minimum. Standard tier (values 2-8) costs 1 point each, premium tier (values 9-10) costs 2 points each.

pointBuyCostEntry.description: A single entry in the point-buy cost table, defining the cost to reach a specific attribute value.

targetValue.description: The attribute value this cost applies to (2-10). Base value of 1 has no cost entry.

individualCost.description: Points required to increment from the previous value to this value. 1 for standard tier (2-8), 2 for premium tier (9-10).

cumulativeCost.description: Total points required to reach this value from the base value of 1.
